ARABIC: فَسُبْحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِى بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Glory be to Him Who has the Dominion of all things in His Hand. To Him you will be returned,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So all glory to Him who holds all power over everything, to whom you will go back in the end.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Holy is He Who has full control over everything, and to Him you shall all be recalled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: All glory belongs to the One in whose hands is the control of all things. To Him you will all return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore Purity is to Him in Whose Hand* is the control over all things and it is towards Him that you will be returned. (Used as a metaphor to mean Power).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So glorified be He and exalted (above all that they associate with Him), and in Whose Hand is the dominion of all things, and to Him you shall be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore glory be to Him in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things, and to Him you shall be brought back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So glory be to Him, in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and unto whom you shall be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Therefor Glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all things! Unto Him ye will be brought back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So glory be to Him who has control over all things. It is to Him that you will all be brought back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Wherefore hallowed be He in whose hand is the governance of everything, and Unto whom ye shall be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So immaculate is He in whose hand is the dominion of all things, and to whom you shall be brought back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So Glorified is He and Exalted above all that they associate with Him, and in Whose Hands is the dominion of all things, and to Him you shall be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Exaltations to Him in whose Hand is the Kingdom of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So glory be to Him in whose hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him you will be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:83] So glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion of all things (malakūt means mulk: the wāw and tā’ have been added for hyperbole) and to Whom you will be returned, restored, in the Hereafter. Meccan: it consists of 182 verses, revealed after [sūrat] al-An‘ām.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Therefore glory be to Him) Allah glorified Himself (in Whose hand is the dominion over all things) the stores of all things and the creating of all things! (Unto Him you will be brought back) after death and He will requite you each according to his works'. And of the surah in which those who set the ranks are mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 181 verses, 860 words and 3,829 letters: Surah 37: Those Who Set the Ranks (al-Saffat) And of the surah in which those who set the ranks are mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 181 verses, 860 words and 3,829 letters:
